name: Summer Creek Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nancy and Dan were great hosts. They helped us better plan our time in Black Hills
reviews.title: Hospitality A plus. Wonderful room - bath - hot tub - fireplace.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really loved our time here. The food was delicious and the room was very comfortable. The conversations we had were great. This place is everything we had hoped for and more. Modern furnishings about 30 miles from Deadwood about 15 minutes from Hill City. We cannot imagine ever staying anywhere else in the Black Hills now. Very clean and tidy. Quiet at night. This inn is for couples and a perfect place for a getaway. This is a small inn so book in advance.
reviews.title: fantastic stay here
Spectacular
reviews.text: Wonderful modern and extremely up to date bed and breakfast. Wonderful rooms, extrememly clean and tidy. Breakfast was fabulous and extremely fresh. It was nice to have freshly squeezed orange juice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say about Summer Creek Inn? From the moment we pulled into the quiet side street, we knew that we struck gold. We were the first to arrive out of all the guests and Nancy was extremely accommodating. She showed us around, fixed us something to drink and sat on the patio with us conversing. We were in the middle of a two week vacation with more than 5000 miles of driving.
reviews.title: Highlight of the Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After we settled into our room, we enjoyed a nice homemade spaghetti dinner with Dan, Nancy, and a few other couples staying at the house. We sat out on the patio and a few hours and enjoyed each other’s company while eating dinner and dessert.
reviews.title: Beautiful modern B&B in the heart of the Black Hills
A fabulous bed and an amazing breakfast!
reviews.text: This amazing property is located about a half hour outside of Rapid City in the Black Hills. It was specifically built to be a bed & breakfast and that makes a difference. The layout of the common rooms is comfortable and the rooms are lovely. Everything is luxurious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Suite 8 - which included a king-sized bed and small balcony. A whirlpool tub with gas fireplace was located in the corner of the room. The tub filled from the ceiling and has all sorts of fun options with color changing lights and different bubble speeds. The room has a nice-sized TV that didn't see much use, with a DVD player --- tons of movies to borrow. The rooms are keyed with a four-digit code rather than with actual keys. This was great for me because I'm always forgetting my keys at hotels --- and when I wanted to duck downstairs for a quick cup of tea, I didn't ever have to worry about where my key was.
reviews.title: The absolute best!!!

reviews.text: The bathroom had double sink - yay! No sharing. The bathroom also had a large shower with two showerheads --- I didn't discover until the last day that you could have both running at the same time - that was definitely nice!
reviews.title: It felt like we were at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The common rooms include a theater room, a pool room, a living room, kitchen and outside seating. We didn't use the pool room, but the theater room is amazing - tons of DVDs to play or you can just watch TV (my husband was way into the Stanley cup finals and was able to watch on the big screen -- a definite treat!). The room has huge leather chairs set up theater style and blankets are available in a basket should you get chilled. The only issue was that Dan and Nancy don't like to start showings late in the evening. Not a problem for us.
reviews.title: Great Location, Amazing Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wine is available for purchase. Tea and coffee and hot chocolate always available 24/7. There's a small "guest fridge" where guests can store beer or other items than need to be chilled.
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else in the Black Hills!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were looking for a destination to get a way for a long weekend and are we ever glad that we found Summer Creek Inn. From the moment we got there, Nancy and Dan treated us like royalty until the moment we left three days later. Everything was perfect from the jacuzzi on the patio right outside our suite to the multi head shower in our spacious bathroom. The beds were extremely comfortable and I haven't slept as well as I did at Summer Creek Inn for a long time.
reviews.title: Our stay at Summer Creek Inn was like a slice of heaven.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dan and Nancy were very gracious hosts and stopped at nothing to make sure that we were enjoying our stay. From the wonderful breakfasts in the mornings to the fresh baked brownies for an afternoon snack There was also a large variety of adult beverages to keep us refreshed after a long day of site seeing.
reviews.title: What an amazing house!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived, warmly greeted by Nancy and Dan and given a tour of this massive, luxurious and amazing house. We stayed in room number 8, very elegantly furnished and with a very comfortable king size bed. The whirlpool bath in the room was quite an experience for us, the water flowing from the ceiling was certainly unusual. Breakfast both days was exquisite, very skilfully prepared by Nancy. We would recommend this to anybody looking for a special place to stay. We loved it!
reviews.title: Breath Taking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dan and Nancy have done an incredible job at creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. They thought of every aspect when they created this getaway. I would give them 6 stars if I could. My wife and I will definitely stay at Summer Creek Inn. I recommend this place to anyone visiting the Black Hills or to any local that just wants to get out of their house for a couple of nights.
reviews.title: Perfect Place... Wonderful Hosts...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Dominic & Amy
reviews.title: The very best of everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why did we love you? Let me count the ways. We loved you to the depth and breathe of girth you added to our frames with your wonderful breakfasts. If only our car could reach you more often. We loved you to the level of everyday conversation on the patio, in the quiet of evening, in the morning sun before breakfast or with the evening glass of wine. Sorry Elizabeth Barrett Browning, but my husband and I must freely turn to praise for Summercreek. The Bed and Breakfast is spotless, warm and inviting. Everything has been thought through with great care from the great beds, wonderful sheets, towels to die for. A movie theater, pool room, baby grand piano, large shower, and 2 soft chairs in the room to relax. Breakfast on the patio with other travelers and great conversations in the dining room, while sipping the glass of great wine from their wonderful selection. Yummy treats like smoked salmon spread, white cheddar cheese spread or chocolate dipped strawberries.
reviews.title: Why did we love you?!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were outstanding from the orange stuffed french toast, souffles, super moist scones, perfect fried potatoes and the freshly squeezed orange juice.
reviews.title: Guitar Heaven... loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Daniel was always ready, willing and able to give directions and information on the area with map and magic marker in hand.
reviews.title: Beyond our expections!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The landscaping is stil a work in progress. However, you know that with the loving care obvious on the inside of the B&B the outside will be equally beautiful when Mother Nature cooperates.
reviews.title: Too Short

reviews.text: But you can have a beautiful home and wonderful cuisine and still not have a 5 star B&B unless the owners were exceptional. Nancy and Daniel you are what made it 5 star. Keep up the GREAT job you are doing.
reviews.title: WOW! You will NOT be disappointed.

description: Treat your senses with a luxurious stay at Summer Creek Inn centrally located in the heart of the hills in Rapid City, SD. Uniquely designed with unexpected comforts, the inn is perfect for your next wedding, family reunion, or corporate retreat. Enjoy hand-painted murals, in-room fireplaces, private whirlpools and home theater at the most exclusive Bed and Breakfast in the region.
